Abstract: This autobiographical review traces the author's journey through the fascinating realm of cannabinoid and endocannabinoid chemistry and pharmacology. The narrative begins with the discovery of anandamide and 2-arachidonoylglycerol (2-AG), the two primary endocannabinoids, and explores their roles in various physiological processes. The author recounts the elucidation of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) and cannabidiol (CBD) structures, highlighting their distinct pharmacological properties and potential therapeutic applications. The review also delves into the identification and characterization of endocannabinoid-like compounds, shedding light on their diverse functions within the endocannabinoid system. Throughout the account, the author reflects on pivotal moments, collaborations, and breakthroughs that have shaped our understanding of cannabinoid science. This personal perspective offers unique insights into the evolution of the field and its impact on modern medicine and neuroscience.
